Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: Torun M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideal for families visiting Amsterdam. Big familyrooms, nice breakfast, quiet surroundings and very friendly staff. We will definitly come back!

Reviews.Title: “It all depends on the room”
Reviews.Author: JD S
Reviews.Content: The Alexander is a well-located hotel in one of the old buildings in town, meaning that it is a narrow and tall place. This also applies to the rooms which are narrow and tall, do not expect a lot of extra space. This is common for all such hotels though. I stayed in room 15 which was unfortunately situated directly off the stairwell, and the stairs are very noisy. Also all the noise from the lobby carried up through the thin door, making this more like a hostel experience in that regard. Earplugs were a must. The room was basically clean, but was starting to show its age. Especially the grouting in the shower would need replacing. Like almost all Amsterdam hotels, the Alexander is overpriced and overrated for what it actually offers, and it would not be ranked as a three star establishment for example in the Nordic countries. With these things things in mind, it is still a recommendable hotel thanks to its location, the fair service and the acceptable quality of its rooms. Just make sure you reserve yours high up and away from the stairwell.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for Amsterdam City Break”
Reviews.Author: lottie007
Reviews.Content: A great hotel for a short City Break in Amsterdam. Boiling Hot Shower, clean towels changed every day and bathroom was immaculate. The bedroom was big enough for 2 friends to be in without feeling tight - you could walk all the way around the bed, there were 2 chairs and a small wardrobe too. We found some english music channels on the TV! The beds were made daily and the sheets and linen was very clean when we arrived. Great service on the desk - gave us maps / lent an adapter plug for an hour as I'd forgotten mine for my straighteners! Brilliant location - about 5 mins walk to the Van Gogh Museum and good tram links when we arrives / left to get to the Central Station. 5 mins walk from some bars and cafes for breakfast and/or evening cocktails, brilliant location for walking around the city centre. I'd absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone going for a short city break. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay here!”
Reviews.Author: pea87
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in Amsterdam with 2 friends and would definitely recommend the Alexander Hotel. The room was lovely, we had a triple room which was number 7. It was really spacious and clean, and the beds were lovely. The receptionist was so helpful and let us leave our bags there before check in. Breakfast was the nicest continental breakfast i have had, things like hot drinks, juice cereals, cake, eggs, bread hot croissants and hot cross buns and fruit. The location was perfect and was so easy to find, id recommend getting the tram 1,2 or 5 to leidesplein and its 5mins walk from there but once you've found you bearings you can easily walk everywhere. would definitely come back!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: zzzzzzzzap
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alexander Hotel for one night in February. It was easy to find and is in a great location for visiting the museums nearby. Staff were attentive and friendly and the room was clean and tidy. The continental breakfast was fairly good with a selection of bread rolls, croissants, jams etc., meats, eggs, cereals and tea and coffee. If you're after somewhere that's comfortable and affordable then you can't go wrong with the Alexander Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fair deal and good location”
Reviews.Author: birdyba
Reviews.Content: We took two rooms just for one night, as we were on a stop-over in Amsterdam. Having read previous reviews, I asked for rooms in the upper floors to make sure we were not given the ones downstairs, almost basement. Good thing we did, the rooms were two floors up, very quiet, tiny but fine for our purpose. As we were staying just for one night, we were happy to have left our luggage at the airport as there is no lift to go up to the rooms. Bathroom was clean, shower hot, and the night staff that welcomed us that night was friendly and helpful. They recommended a good place to eat dutch dishes in the very nearby Liedseplein area (just 2 to 3 blocks away), called The Pantry. In the morning we had just a little time to walk around which the location of the hotel allowed for perfectly. Breakfast was not included in our rate and too expensive for what I saw they offered for euro 10 per person. All in all, a fair deal and very well located.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quiet hotel near Amsterdam Museums. Good value!”
Reviews.Author: surreal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alexander in January 2012 because we wished to be within easy reach of; key museums, places to eat, tramway connections, pleasant walks and shopping. (Trams 1, 2 and 5 from Central Station to Leidseplein and then a five minute walk) The hotel is on a quiet street in the museum area. There's a park nearby with it's cafe.A great area to walk or ride a hired bike through towards the Van Gogh museum and beyond. The hotel staff were welcoming and helpful in all ways, recommending good eateries etc. They gave us early access to a room giving us time for a rest after our journey before we set off on our visits. The bedroom and bathroom were very clean and a good size for the two of us.There is a lift to all floors. The buffet breakfast was sound and would suit most tastes. A really pleasant, quiet hotel near everything that's 'Amsterdam' at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Top value!”
Reviews.Author: Bisanten
Reviews.Content: Alexander is very nice hotel with friendly and very helpful staff. My husband and I have arrived few hours earlier of check-in time and they have been keeping our belongings in a security room as long as we wanted. The same service we had on our departure day. The location is excellent (just behind Marriott Hotel): easy to get to from the airport (bus #197), 5-7minutes from the city centre. Museums, restaurants/cafÃ© area are within walking distance; the Canal Cruise Tours stop -5minutes away. The street is quite and beautiful. Very clean warm rooms, very well ventilated, good shower (no probs with hot water). I would recommend this hotel as a best value!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant weekend in Amsterdam, staying in the excellent Hotel Alexander”
Reviews.Author: LizDublinIreland
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I stayed in a triple room in the Hotel Alexander in October. It was fantastic! Our room was lovely and the service could not have been better. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful, making personal recommendations for sight-seeing, shopping, restaurants and jazz venues. The Hotel was perfectly located within walking distance of everywhere we wanted to go. We will definitely recommend this hotel to friends, and we plan to go there again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but beware of the basement rooms”
Reviews.Author: Belfastfamily11
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in November, booked a triple room for my husband teenage son and my self, we were put in a basement room that was very cramped and airless there was very little natural light and if you opened the window it was extremely noisy. It was more like staying in a hostel that a hotel- very bad level of service. Staff were dismissive of our complaints about the room and stated as we had booked late and you get what you pay for! We had a great time in Amsterdam and will go back but will never stay in this hotel again. It is without doubt the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: juanajane
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable, but the size of our room was tiny...hardly room to move around. We did ask for a larger room but were told the hotel was too full. I would recommend the location...close to restaurants, bars, and great shopping on the '9 streets'. Maybe the 'Vondel " down the street has bigger rooms....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TomasBillik
Reviews.Content: Small friendly hotel which caters mostly to tourists. Street parking is available, however it is very expensive. When I arrived I parked on the street only for an hour while checking in, and after that I brought my car to Olympic Stadium P+R parking which costs only 8 EUR per 24 hours. It was only a short tram ride back to the hotel. Rooms were clean, however quite aged and small, but I didn't care too much as I only slept there. Breakfast was quite bland. Wifi is available, you can purchase a card with a password for 20 EUR which will allow you to use the wifi for 10 hours. The best feature of the hotel was the location - walking distance to Leidseplein with many great restaurants and good tram connection around the city. Museum distric is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Alexander Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: alina c
Reviews.Content: After great difficulty finding a hotel in Amsterdam we decided on this facility. Even though the rooms were small for american standards we realize that they are average for hotels in Amsterdam of even greater star ratings and price. The location is excellent. I would advice anyone to stay in this area instead of the very busy and crowded center around Dam Square. There are excellent restaurants, museums, parks, shopping and quiet streets. The Staff (thank you again J and Tony) made all the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home”
Reviews.Author: Robyn G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two weeks in September 2011 at the Alexander Hotel. The location is perfect for a vacation in Amsterdam -- a quiet residential street that is close to many of the major attractions and good restaurants. It is also just a short walk in either direction to the trams and canal excursions. We had everything we needed during our stay including breakfast every morning, a nice bathroom, and a clean and comfortable room and bedding, The terrace off of the breakfast room is very pretty with tables and flower boxes, and coffee and tea are available all of the time. The feature that sets this hotel apart from others, however, is the friendly and helpful staff. Several times we came back from dinner in the evening and chatted with the staff about what we did that day. They added our experiences to their list of recommendations to give to future guests and offered their ideas for sights and activities we might enjoy during our stay. We had lots of laughs and they shared many things about living in Amsterdam and Holland. It was very homelike. We will stay at this hotel again if we do a return visit to Amsterdam -- and we may return to Amsterdam just to stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Top choice for budget travellers!”
Reviews.Author: Tarova
Reviews.Content: Alexander was like an oasis after a long day of hotel room searching (on foot) without success. After all the dumpsters we had seen that day (very busy weekend-Amsterdam hotels were all fully booked due to multiple fairs) this hotel seemed like the perfect refuge. Simple, small, clean, offering great location. Best room that our money could buy..

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: ileus
Reviews.Content: Close to tram, very clean and spacious room. Elevator only to 3rd.floor.

Reviews.Title: “Frendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Leonor S
Reviews.Content: I've been there for 7 nights. Good location in a quiet sreet.The room was a litle beat small but the people were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “We went back again!”
Reviews.Author: ingabinga52
Reviews.Content: I came back to Hotel Alexander and as I stated in 2007 it is a great hotel in a great location. Once again service was excellent. We received maps and directions to local attractions and help navigating out of the city for additional travel. The breakfast was good with variety of options and the coffee great. See my 2007 review for additional information

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: JHROrange
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights at the Hotel Alexander in early July, 2011. Three were with a Rick Steves tour and two were solo (paid 95 euro which included breakfast). As I was alone in the room the entire time, I did not mind the small size. I loved it! I was cozy and had everything I needed. My room looked over the garden, had a mini fridge, and a fan up on the wall for cooling purposes and additional white noise. The bathroom was decent size with plenty of room to lay out toiletry items. Our group enjoyed the outside balcony area to gather for drinks before going out to dinner. There is an Albert Heijn grocery store right by tram stop #1 on Overtoom. Also, an organic food store on Overtoom near the hotel that only takes credit cards, no cash. As other reviewers have noted, the hotel is located close to trams 1, 2, and 5, as well as the Leidseplein. I walked to the Rijks and Van Gogh Museums. Here is my special story about the Hotel Alexander...Two young brothers work the front desk and they both were always very courteous and helpful to me. I wanted to attend an outdoor dance performance in Vondel Park and I asked him the location of the theater in the Park. He tried to describe it to me, but the park is very large. I did find the theater and had a wonderful experience. After I returned, I discovered that he had walked the park in hopes that he would see me again to give me more detailed instructions as how to find the theater. Yes, there may be a few quirks such as a 4% charge for a credit card and having to pay a little bit to use the lobby computers, but my visit to Amsterdam was definitely enhanced by staying at the Hotel Alexander.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marina_ua
Reviews.Content: Stayed in that hotel 24-28 June. I chose that hotel because of a lot of positive reviews on it here, and have to say that I did not regret about my choice!! Alexander hotel is situated in the excellent location, right near Leidepslain Square, where are a lot of cafes, restaurants, clubs, boat trip stop and other tourist entertainments. I took single room, it was a litlle bit small, but very very cozy, enough for one person! the bed was not small, even too big for only me. Bathroom was very clean and enough modern. The service in the hotel was incredible- always clean room, special thanks to J and Tony on the reception! They always helped with any information or any other consultations that were needed. The breakfast was quit good: jogurts, tomatoes, fruits, bread, a lot of cheese, tea coffee water orange juice. And all that you get for very very decent price! I should definitely recommend this hotel to everybody, and surely will come back here when next time in Amsterdam. Thanks to Alexander Hotel and to all people who work there for incredible vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a great city”
Reviews.Author: JMD2007
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well-located but far enough away from the noisy nightlife. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean and well-maintained. I have no complaints about the hotel. I was there with friends, but I would have felt comfortable staying there alone. Enjoy Amsterdam and watch out for bikes!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: natmoto22
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really easy to find, down a lovely quiet street, but very close to central Amsterdam and Leidsplein square. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a very smiley, young receptionist who was very helpful and very polite. The reception is small, but clean and tidy. All rooms are very clean and have a small bathroom, but the shower is quite good. TV with english channels if you turn it on, comfy pillows, good full lenth mirrors. Rooms are basic, but for the location and cleaniness i would definately recommend to stay here. The location is the best thing about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: L0ve2seeTheW0rld
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly. The hotel is family owned and kept very clean. Fluent English speakers who were very helpful. No frills, but a great location. Wish the wifi was included.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Amsterdam !!”
Reviews.Author: Arfeiz
Reviews.Content: I have been in Amsterdam with my girlfriend for 4 days and stayed at hotel Alexander. We chose for this hotel because we read some nice reviews and because we wanted to be near the museum district. The area where this hotel is located is a nice and quiet area. On my last trip I stayed at a hotel near the central station, i will never do that again, it's so noisy and busy there. This hotel is located very central, but still in a quiet area. Our room was very clean and offered everything we needed, maybe the size of the room was not that large, but we are in Amsterdam for the city, not to stay in our room all day. The bed was comfortable and the breakfast was very nice. The hotel also has a beautiful garden where you can sit and have a drink to escape all the hustle and bustle from Amsterdam. The staff is also very very nice, they are always willing to help and even knew us by our names. We will definitely come back to this hotel on our next visit to Amsterdam and we reccommend YOU ALL TO VISIT Hotel ALEXANDER in Amsterdam! Have fun!

HotelInfo.Name: Alexander Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Vondelstraat 44-48, Amsterdam 1054 GE, The Netherlands
